00035 double purify_ran_gasdev2(int idum) {
00036 
00037   double gasdev2_dp;
00038   double fac,rsq,v1,v2;
00039   static int iset = 0;
00040   static double gset = 0.0;
00041     
00042   if (iset ==0) {
00043     do {
00044       v1=2.*purify_ran_ran2(idum)-1.;
00045       v2=2.*purify_ran_ran2(idum)-1.;
00046       rsq=v1*v1+v2*v2;
00047     } while(rsq >= 1.0 || rsq == 0.0);
00048     fac=sqrt(-2.*log(rsq)/rsq);
00049     gset=v1*fac;
00050     gasdev2_dp=v2*fac;
00051     iset=1;
00052   }
00053   else {
00054     gasdev2_dp=gset;
00055     iset=0;
00056   }
00057   
00058   return gasdev2_dp;
00059       
00060 }

00087 double purify_ran_ran2(int idum) {
00088 
00089   int IM1=2147483563,IM2=2147483399,IMM1=IM1-1, 
00090     IA1=40014,IA2=40692,IQ1=53668,IQ2=52774,IR1=12211,IR2=3791, 
00091     NTAB=32,NDIV=1+IMM1/NTAB;
00092 
00093   double AM=1./IM1,EPS=1.2e-7,RNMX=1.-EPS;
00094   int j,k;
00095   static int iv[32],iy,idum2 = 123456789; 
00096   // N.B. in C static variables are initialised to 0 by default.
00097 
00098   if (idum <= 0) {
00099     idum= (-idum>1 ? -idum : 1); // max(-idum,1);
00100     idum2=idum;
00101     for(j=NTAB+8;j>=1;j--) {
00102       k=idum/IQ1;
00103       idum=IA1*(idum-k*IQ1)-k*IR1;
00104       if (idum < 0) idum=idum+IM1;
00105       if (j < NTAB) iv[j-1]=idum;
00106     }
00107     iy=iv[0];
00108   }
00109   k=idum/IQ1;
00110   idum=IA1*(idum-k*IQ1)-k*IR1;
00111   if (idum < 0) idum=idum+IM1;
00112   k=idum2/IQ2;
00113   idum2=IA2*(idum2-k*IQ2)-k*IR2;
00114   if (idum2 < 0) idum2=idum2+IM2;
00115   j=1+iy/NDIV;
00116   iy=iv[j-1]-idum2;
00117   iv[j-1]=idum;
00118   if(iy < 1)iy=iy+IMM1;
00119   return (AM*iy < RNMX ? AM*iy : RNMX); // min(AM*iy,RNMX);
00120 
00121 }

00140 int purify_ran_knuthshuffle(int *perm, int nperm, int N, int seed) {
00141 
00142   int *scratch;
00143   int i, j, tmp, nmax;
00144 
00145   // Check inputs.
00146   if (nperm > N) {
00147     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Number of required permutations greater than number of integers");
00148     return 1;
00149   }
00150       
00151   // Allocate scratch space.
00152   scratch = (int*)malloc(N * sizeof(int));
00153   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(scratch);
00154 
00155   // Initialise scratch space.
00156   for (i = 0; i < N; i++)
00157     scratch[i] = i;
00158 
00159   // Initialise random number generator with negative seed.
00160   seed = abs(seed);
00161   purify_ran_ran2(-seed);
00162 
00163   // Compute permutation.
00164   // If require nperm = N permutations then don't permute last element.
00165   nmax = nperm < N-1 ? nperm : N-1; // min(nperm, N-1)
00166   for (i = 0; i < nmax; i++) {
00167 
00168     // Generate random index j in [i,N-1].
00169     j = (int)(purify_ran_ran2(seed) * (N - i));
00170     j = j + i;
00171 
00172     // Although j in [i,N-1] enforce this to be sure.
00173     j = (j >= N ? N-1 : j);
00174     j = (j < i ? i : j);
00175 
00176     // Swap entries i and j.
00177     tmp = scratch[i];
00178     scratch[i] = scratch[j];
00179     scratch[j] = tmp;
00180 
00181   }
00182     
00183   // Copy required data from scratch space.
00184   for (i = 0; i < nperm; i++)
00185     perm[i] = scratch[i];
00186 
00187   // Free memory.
00188   free(scratch);
00189 
00190   return 0;
00191 }
